heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 21 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (177°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 56.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 2.3°C) and inside temperature (down 1.5°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 11%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 868 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 53.8°C), dew point temperature (up 48.9°C), outside temperature (up 52.7°C), and cloud levels (up 499 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 867.8m lower than yesterday, 499.0m lower than the past week, 384.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 1011m and a peak of 4080m, averaging 1324.6m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; relatively cool weather. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and winds will be practically absent. Possible light showers, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and it’s dim outside. High pressure suggests settled weather.
